intro: Exocarpos phyllanthoides var. brachystachys, commonly known as the dwarf starfruit, is a compact shrub native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It produces small, yellow-orange fruits that resemble starfruits, though they are typically smaller and less elongated. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
